title: Hixkaryana (2010) New Testament
description: Hixkaryana /ˌhɪʃkæriˈɑːnə/ is one of the Cariban languages, spoken by just over 500 people on the Nhamundá River, a tributary of the Amazon River in Brazil. It is one of around a dozen languages that are described as having object–verb–subject word order.

language.name: Hixkaryána
language.area: Amazonas, upper Nhamunda River to Mapuera and Jatapú rivers.
